alert.note: Alert for Kent; Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 7:59PM EDT until July 29 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Windham County in northern Connecticut... Northwestern Kent County in Rhode Island... Southwestern Providence County in Rhode Island... * Until 845 PM EDT. * At 758 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Brooklyn, or near Plainfield, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Cranston, Coventry, Johnston, Plainfield, Killingly, Scituate, Brooklyn, West Greenwich, Canterbury, Foster and Sterling. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
